metadata.title: CVE-2015-8388 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
PCRE before 8.38 mishandles the /(?=di(?<=(?1))|(?=(.))))/ pattern andrelated patterns with an unmatched closing parenthesis, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (buffer overflow) or possibly haveunspecified other impact via a crafted regular expression, as demonstratedby a JavaScript RegExp object encountered by Konqueror.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8388` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre3 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
libpcrecpp0 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
pcregrep - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pcre3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1').
